item.title: Systemd
item.description: systemd is a common service manager in use by many Linux distributions. resticprofile has the ability to create systemd timer and service files. systemd can be used in place of cron to schedule backups. User systemd units are created under the user’s systemd profile (~/.config/systemd/user). System units are created in /etc/systemd/system systemd calendars resticprofile uses systemd OnCalendar format to schedule events. Testing systemd calendars can be done with the systemd-analyze application.
